ai-iti111:0.3_0: The Chapter on the Holy Offering of the Teaching
ai-iti111:1.1_0: For this was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti111:2.1_0: “Mendicants, live with ethics has been explained and eliminated.
ai-iti111:2.1_1: Live restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and seeking alms in suitable places.
ai-iti111:2.1_2: undertake and train in the training rules.
ai-iti111:3.1_0: Live restrained in the code of conduct, conducting yourselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, keep the rules you’ve undertaken.
ai-iti111:4.1_0: Suppose a mendicant has got rid of desire and ill will while walking, and has given up dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt. Their energy is roused up and unflagging, their mindfulness is established and lucid, their body is tranquil and undisturbed, and their mind is immersed in samādhi.
ai-iti111:4.2_0: Such a mendicant is said to be ‘keen and prudent, always energetic and determined’ when walking.
ai-iti111:5.1_0: Suppose a mendicant has got rid of desire and ill will while standing ...
ai-iti111:5.1_3: Their energy is roused up and unflagging, their mindfulness is established and lucid, their body is tranquil and undisturbed, and their mind is immersed in samādhi.
ai-iti111:5.2_0: a mendicant who is practicing like this is said to be ‘keen and prudent, always energetic and determined’ when walking.
ai-iti111:6.1_0: If a mendicant has got rid of desire and ill will while sitting in this way,
ai-iti111:6.1_3: Their energy is roused up and unflagging, their mindfulness is established and lucid, their body is tranquil and undisturbed, and their mind is immersed in samādhi.
ai-iti111:6.2_0: Such a mendicant is said to be ‘keen and prudent, always energetic and determined’ when walking.
ai-iti111:7.1_0: or when lying down while awake.
ai-iti111:7.1_3: Their energy is roused up and unflagging, their mindfulness is established and lucid, their body is tranquil and undisturbed, and their mind is immersed in samādhi.
ai-iti111:7.2_0: Such a mendicant is said to be ‘keen and prudent, always energetic and determined’ when lying down while awake.”
ai-iti111:8.4_0: If the ending of the robe-making season were left.
ai-iti111:9.1_0: if it is below the collar bone but above;
ai-iti111:9.2_0: as far as the scope of the range.
ai-iti111:9.3_0: His retinue is equal to things
ai-iti111:9.4_0: of the rise and fall of the aggregates,
ai-iti111:10.3_0: training in what leads to serenity of heart,
ai-iti111:10.6_0: in the four kinds of questions.
ai-iti111:11.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
